chargeHist.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan Micheal Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.02(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to sentences in Green Lake County cases 15CF53 & 15CM41

superMiscConds.notes: *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharges.  *Restitution to be determined after a hearing is held.  *Maintain absolute sobriety.  *Pay supervision fees  *Participate and complete any other counseling deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the agent.  *Maintain full-time employment.  *Psychological examnination and comply.

dated 3/20/17
-IT IS ORDERED that the time to file a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is hereby extended to May 22/2017

Motion to Extend Time for Filing Notice of Appeal or Postconviction Motion
(filed w/Ct of Appeals)

Defendant appeared by his attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearances stated, and matter before the court. DOC noted sentence credit of 36 days appears to have been duplicated and should actually be modified. Atty Klopp objected sating DOC is not a party to the action and cannot motion for change. Atty Klopp wants creidt left at the 36 days. DA stated no objection.  Court's stated his understanding and is not modifying sentence credit.  BTC:  Sentence credit of 36 days stands as previously ordered.
From State Public Defenders Office-Appellate Division

Defendant Jonathan Micheal Meyer in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Jonathan Micheal Meyer in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is a continued restitution hearing  and Atty Klopp was ready to proceed at that time.  
Jonathan Meyer called and sworn; examined by Atty Klopp.
Cross-examined by Atty Hendee.
Re-direct by Atty Klopp.  Exhibit 1 marked by Atty Klopp.
Atty Hendee does not object to Exhibit 1.
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit 1 received.
Witness excused.

Atty Hendee makes arguments.
Atty Klopp makes arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders Restitution of $150,0000 to be paid to the victim, State Farm Insurance.

Atty Klopp asks about the defendant's prison wages.
BY THE COURT:  Court will not make a ruling on how much of the defendant's prison wages may be taken for payment of restitution.

Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment 03-2-16
Reporter Jill Bartol

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan Micheal Meyer in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Jonathan Micheal Meyer in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel have received the PSI and are prepared to proceed today.  Atty Klopp states a few changes.  Sally Bonnell (defendant's mother) makes statement.    State has complied with victim notification requirements.  Counsel make sentencing arguments.  Atty Hendee requests 15 years initial confinement followed by 10 years Extended Supervision with conditions.  Atty Klopp requests 5 or less years initial confinement followed by 8 years Extended Supervision. Defendant makes statement.   
BY THE COURT:  Court sentences defendant to 18 years in the Wisconsin Prison System.  10 years initial confinement, followed by 8 years Extended Supervision.  Granted 36 days credit.  Consecutive to sentences in Green Lake County cases 15CF53 and 15CM41.  Conditions of ES:  *Pay costs of $268.00.  *Submit DNA sample if not already provided and pay surcharge of $250.00.  Restitution to be determined after a hearing is held.  *Mainain absolute sobriety.  *Pay supervision fees.  *Participate and complete AODA treatment.  *Participate and complete any other counseling deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the agent.  *Maintain full-time employment.  *Psychological examination and comply.  *Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
 Restitution hearing will be set with the JA.
Sentencing hearing on July 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jonathan Micheal Meyer in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Jonathan Micheal Meyer in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Klopp states that there is an offer, however, the defendant has charges in Stevens Point and so he is looking into consolidation.  Atty Klopp has not had contact with the Attorney there. Atty Klopp asks for some additional time to look into the consolidation.

Court received a report from Dr. Bernie and questions if the defendant received that.  Atty Klopp states that yes they have received that report.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.

Atty Klopp asks for brief moment with his client.
BY THE COURT:  Court will take a short recess.

Back on the record:
Atty Hendee states that the defendant will plea today.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Counts 2, 3 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Hendee states that the parties would ber requesting a PSI to be done.  Atty Klopp agrees but states that he did not think that the defendant was going to plea today however, it is his clients wish to move forward today with a no contest plea.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and would like to move forward on this matter today.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Counts 2, 3 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.
PSI ordered.
Defendant is remanded into custody until the sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 10:00 am.
to Court from Kent Berney, Ph.D.
Return date on May 13, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Jonathan Micheal Meyer in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Jonathan Micheal Meyer in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Klopp states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Klopp has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee asks for time to file the information with the Court.  Atty Klopp would like the information filed today.  
BY THE COURT:  Recess to give time for the information to be filed.

Back on the Record:
  Atty Hendee files the information with the court.    Atty Klopp states that the Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.  Atty Klopp enters an NGI plea.

BY THE COURT:  NGI plea entered.
Court appoints Dr. Bernie to do an evaluation.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 10:15 am.

Defendant Jonathan Micheal Meyer in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Jonathan Micheal Meyer in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Klopp states he was just appointed and requests adjournment.  
BY THE COURT:  Reset to March.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jonathan Micheal Meyer in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Jonathan Micheal Meyer in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is the defendant's motion to modify the bond.  Atty Gumz states motion.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant's probation was revoked and is serving his sentence for Green Lake County.  Atty Gumz asks to modify the cash bond to $1,000 cash.  Atty Hendee responds and asks the court to deny the motion.

BY THE COURT:  Motion denied.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Modification of Bail

Defendant Jonathan Micheal Meyer in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Jonathan Micheal Meyer in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz states that he will be filing a motion to modify the bail.  
Atty Gumz waives the time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; set Return date.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
